report_title: Pallet and Skid Rental Industry Report
executive_summary: The pallet and skid rental industry rents pallets and skids to manufacturers, retailers and other downstream market users. Pallets are flat transport structures that support the movement and lifting of goods and containers; skids are similar to pallets but have no bottom deck boards. Most pallets are wooden, though they can also be manufactured using plastic or recycled material.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Pallet and skid rental revenue growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Pallet and skid rental revenue has grown at a CAGR of 2.0% to $3.5 billion over the past five years, including an estimated jump of 1.8% in 2023 alone, with profit set to climb to 17.4% of revenue.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Pandemic impact on demand and revenue
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The pandemic drastically impacted demand for products due to slowing consumer spending levels and supply chain disruptions. Following lockdown measures, nonessential businesses were forced to close in the first half of 2020. This limited industry demand, particularly from retailers, the industry's largest market.

Demand for services has climbed over the past five years as the US economy experienced growth despite the pandemic. Rising per capita disposable income levels have encouraged individuals to spend more on commercial goods.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Pallet and skid rental revenue is expected to climb at a CAGR of 2.8% to $4.1 billion over the next five years and profit is estimated to jump and account for 18.1% of revenue in 2028.

Over the past five years, improving consumer conditions will stimulate US retail activity, boosting demand for services. Increased consumer spending will stimulate US industrial activity, causing the nation's industrial production index to jump, generating demand for pallets and skids to transport and store finished and unfinished goods.

Given the significant cost of purchasing pallets and skids, long-term rental agreements can provide downstream clients with considerable upfront cost savings. Rentals are especially desirable in markets where pallets must be cleaned regularly, like grocery stores and food retail markets.

industry_definition: This industry comprises establishments that primarily rent pallets and skids to downstream markets for the storage and transport of goods. Following use, pallets and skids are returned to industry operators for cleaning and repairs. Though pallets and skids differ slightly in their construction and purposes, the terms are largely interchangeable.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: low - increasing

key_trends: Demand for this industry's services is largely driven by the volume of freight being transported within the US economy
Industry performance is closely tied to US trade activity, as pallets and skids are often required for transporting cargo between manufacturers
Several states maintain regulations that mandate the use of plastic pallets for the transportation of food products to reduce the risk of contamination
Consumer spending is forecast to rise steadily, sustaining demand for pallets
More downstream industries will adopt pallet and skid rental programs
Profit is expected to remain high due to large freight volumes and strong retail activity
Renting has become an increasingly popular method for obtaining pallets and skids in recent years

market_segmentation.segment_description: The retail and wholesale sectors represent the industry's largest customer base, accounting for over one-half of revenue. Wholesalers receive goods from domestic and foreign manufacturers and dispatch those goods to retail outlets as needed and many retailers purchase goods directly from manufacturers.

The manufacturing sector represents the second-largest market for the industry. Most manufacturing pursuits require pallets for transporting and storing raw materials, finished goods, machinery support (especially for skids) and warehousing functions.
Grocery stores are the third-largest market because pallets are an essential supply chain component for grocery stores.
Pallet options represent an important part of daily operations in the supercenter and mass retailer sector.

products_and_services.product_or_service: GMA Wooden Pallet and Skid Rentals
products_and_services.product_description: Most industry pallets and skids are manufactured using wood, including hardwood, softwood, wooden composites and recycled wood materials. Wooden pallets are relatively inexpensive, so operators typically charge lower fees to customers renting these products.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Non-GMA Wooden Pallet and Skid Rentals
products_and_services.product_description: Most industry pallets and skids are manufactured using wood, including hardwood, softwood, wooden composites and recycled wood materials. Wooden pallets are relatively inexpensive, so operators typically charge lower fees to customers renting these products.
This segment includes skids and pallets made from plastic, metal, composite paper and other materials.

tier_1_suppliers: Wood Pallets & Skids Production in the US
Janitorial Equipment Supply Wholesaling in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Soap & Cleaning Compound Manufacturing in the US
Screw, Nut & Bolt Manufacturing in the US
tier_1_buyers: Warehouse Clubs & Supercenters in the US
Public Storage & Warehousing in the US
Farm Product Storage & Warehousing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The industry's primary customers are wholesalers, retailers and consumer goods manufacturers. The performance of these industries is critical to industry demand.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: The Ability of Downstream Clients to Purchase Their Own Equipment
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Demand for pallet and skid rentals is also affected by the ability of downstream clients to purchase their own equipment.

international_trade_points.trade_description: The service-based nature of industry services limits the opportunity for trading goods across international borders. The industry lacks export revenue and US operators primarily satisfy domestic demand.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Larger operators have foreign rental businesses
international_trade_points.trade_description: However, some of the industry's larger operators, like CHEP, operate rental businesses in several foreign markets.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region has the largest concentration of operators, accounting for one-quarter of establishments. Major consumer markets in Atlanta and Miami make the Southeast a popular destination for operators.
The West accounts for the second-largest concentration of operators.
The Southwest comprises the third-largest concentration of industry establishments.

regulations_points.regulation_title: Downstream industries have regulations regarding the types of pallets they accept
regulations_points.regulation_description: Costco maintains strict standards for the types of pallets it will and will not accept.
The National Wooden Pallet and Container Association administer a fumigation program that conforms to international standards.
The US Environmental Protection Agency aims to improve supply chain efficiencies and reduce transportation-related emissions through initiatives.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The industry is in a mature life cycle stage, increasing barriers.
The industry has a high level of capital intensity, increasing barriers.
The industry receives low to steady levels of assistance.
The industry has low to steady levels of globalization.
The industry is moderately fragmented with little concentration of ownership.
New entrants face significant challenges like accessing capital for equipment.

basis_points.basis_title: Price is a major deciding factor
basis_points.basis_description: Price is a major deciding factor in choosing one operator over another.
Larger companies can offer lower per-unit prices.
Perceived product quality and product development are crucial for operators.

basis_points.basis_title: Different pallet types for different purposes
basis_points.basis_description: Different types of wooden pallets are suited for different purposes.

basis_points.basis_title: Plastic pallets required by some industries
basis_points.basis_description: Plastic pallets are required by some industries.
Customer service is a major basis of competition for operators.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Top 2 players account for over 75% revenue
concentration_points.concentration_description: The industry's two largest players account for over three-quarters of revenue in 2023.
The industry's largest player, Brambles Limited, accounts for just under three-quarters of revenue alone in 2023.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Larger operators can design and distribute easier
concentration_points.concentration_description: As certain pallet designs become more desirable, larger companies can design and distribute these easier.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchases Have Jumped Over The Past Five Years
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchase costs are expected to account for 6.8% of revenue in 2023.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Depreciation Costs Lag but Encounter Volatility
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Depreciation expenses are expected to account for 9.8% of revenue in 2023.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The pallet and skid rental industry is characterized by a high level of capital intensity, with the typical operator spending an estimated $0.52 on capital investments for every $1.00 spent on labor inputs.

volatility_points.volatility_description: The pallet and skid rental industry has exhibited a moderate level of revenue volatility over the past five years.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: The pallet and skid rental industry does not experience technological disruption.
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The pallet and skid rental industry provides straightforward services.
Many of the largest players rely on automation technologies.

FAQs.question: How has discretionary spending affected your major consumers? How did supply chain disruptions affect demand during 2020?
FAQs.answer: Increased spending has been good for the industry. As consumers purchase more, demand for pallets will increase.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on total trade value?
FAQs.answer: Yes, as trade value increases, pallet use increases.

FAQs.question: Is your company located near large travel hubs?
FAQs.answer: Yes, it is in the best interest of companies to be close to transport hubs.

FAQs.question: How do you keep your capital expenditure budgets at a minimum and ensure timely completion of projects?
FAQs.answer: - Streamlining operations through Just in time inventory management - Levering technological advancements.

FAQs.question: How many types of pallets and skids do you offer?
FAQs.answer: - Many downstream clients have policies in place regarding the types of pallets they use.

FAQs.question: How is your company investing in technology?
FAQs.answer: The use of pallet tracking allows companies to better manage inventory.
